alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 4:18PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pickens, central Greene and north central Sumter Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 418 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gainesville, or 13 miles north of Livingston, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eutaw, Boligee, Union, Gainesville, Epes, New West Greene, Mantua, Allison, West Greene, Knoxville, Benevola, Snoddy, New Mount Hebron, Clinton, Pleasant Ridge, Lewiston and I 20 Rest Area Near Eutaw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
